intro: Senecio palenae, commonly known as the Cape York Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Senecio palenae is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand high salinity and strong winds.
